citations.narrative:
Housekeeping. There are rolls chain-link fencing, wire mesh, metal siding, fence posts, gate, lumber, old wooden siding,
and an exposed electric wire on the ground in the upper enclosure housing 5 goats, 3 sheep, and 2 fallow deer. Items left
on the ground could injure the animals in this enclosure. Buildings and grounds must be kept clean and in good repair to
protect the animals from injury. Licensee must maintain enclosures in good repair by removing rolls of chain-link fencing,
wire mesh, metal siding, fence posts, gate, lumber, old wooden siding, and expose electric wire from the enclosure
housing the goats, sheep, and fallow deer.

Storage. There are open bags of food on the floor in the bird room. Open food and storing feed on the floor can cause
molding and contamination of the feed. Supplies of food and bedding must be stored off the floor and away from walls to
allow cleaning around and underneath supplies. Open food must be stored in a manner that prevents deterioration
spoilage, or contamination such as in a container with a lid. Correct by September 15, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.131(c)  Repeat
   
Sanitation. 
Housekeeping. There are rolls chain-link fencing, wire mesh, metal siding, fence posts, gate, lumber, old wooden siding, 
and an exposed electric wire on the ground in the upper enclosure housing 5 goats, 3 sheep, and 2 fallow deer. Items left 
on the ground could injure the animals in this enclosure. Buildings and grounds must be kept clean and in good repair to 
protect the animals from injury. Licensee must maintain enclosures in good repair by removing rolls of chain-link fencing, 
wire mesh, metal siding, fence posts, gate, lumber, old wooden siding, and expose electric wire from the enclosure 
housing the goats, sheep, and fallow deer. 
3.150(e) 
   
Facilities, general. 
Storage. There are open bags of food on the floor in the bird room. Open food and storing feed on the floor can cause 
molding and contamination of the feed. Supplies of food and bedding must be stored off the floor and away from walls to 
allow cleaning around and underneath supplies. Open food must be stored in a manner that prevents deterioration 
spoilage, or contamination such as in a container with a lid. Correct by September 15, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
